meanings.definition: To wind or twist tightly together
meanings.sent1: She had to supercoil the rope to make sure it wouldn't unravel.
meanings.sent2: The snake can supercoil its body around the tree branch for support.
meanings.sent3: The kids thought it was funny to supercoil the jump rope around the tree and play tug-of-war.
meanings.sent4: His anxiety seemed to supercoil around his heart, making it hard to breathe.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds seemed to supercoil in the sky, ready to unleash their fury.

meanings.definition: A coil that is wound tightly beyond its normal state
meanings.sent1: The spring in the clock had a supercoil that made it tick louder than usual.
meanings.sent2: The supercoil in the slinky toy allowed it to bounce higher than the regular coils.
meanings.sent3: The supercoil of hair on the doll's head made it look like a fancy hairstyle.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room felt like a supercoil ready to snap at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The supercoil of wire in the machine hummed with energy, ready to power the device.
